terms.definition: A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions if needed.
Standard Operating Procedure - detailed written instructions that describe how to perform routine tasks or processes consistently and safely.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
Enterprise Resource Planning - integrated software systems that manage and automate core business processes like inventory, accounting, and human resources.
Product Lifecycle Management - software systems that manage product data and processes throughout a product's entire lifecycle from conception to disposal.
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously edit, review, and update documents with changes visible instantly to all participants.
A single, unified storage location where all organizational documents are stored, organized, and accessed from one central system.
An international standard that specifies requirements for quality management systems, helping organizations ensure consistent quality in their products and services.
Restriction of Hazardous Substances - European Union directive that restricts the use of specific hazardous materials in electrical and electronic products.
An industry standard that defines the acceptability criteria for electronic assemblies, specifying quality requirements for soldering and component installation.
Work groups composed of members from different departments or specialties who collaborate to achieve common goals or complete projects.
The process of ensuring that an organization adheres to laws, regulations, and industry standards relevant to their business operations.
Documentation that tracks modifications made to manufacturing processes, including the rationale, implementation details, and impact assessment.
Software capability that allows content to be created, managed, and displayed in multiple languages to serve global audiences.
A centralized location or system that serves as the authoritative reference point for specific data or information, eliminating conflicting versions.
